properties.areaDesc: Northern Oxford; Northern Coos; Southern Coos; Central Somerset; Northern Franklin
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 6 at 3:08AM EST until February 7 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
...Wintry Precipitation to Impact New England through Friday...

.A series of low pressure disturbances are expected to impact the
region today and again on Friday. Wintry precipitation will begin
in southern New Hampshire this morning, and will overspread the
remainder of New Hampshire and much of western Maine by the morning
rush hour. Although there will be a lull in precipitation for
some areas late today and early tonight, the potential for a
wintry mix of precipitation will continue, with additional
accumulating snowfall possible Friday. This will make for slick
morning and evening commutes both days.

* WHAT...Heavy snow and sleet expected. Total snow accumulations
of 9 to 17 inches and sleet accumulations of around 1/2 of an
inch expected.

* WHERE...In New Hampshire, Southern Coos and Northern Coos
Counties. In Maine, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin and
Northern Oxford Counties.

* WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 10 PM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening
commutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While this is a prolonged event, the
highest snowfall amounts are expected from late Thursday night
through the end of the event on Friday.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to
www.weather.gov/gray..

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM EST FRIDAY
